Welcome to ussolar’s documentation!¶

ussolar.esri¶

The esri module contains functions and classes related to arcpy and other esri services

class ussolar.esri.API¶

Class that represents an ArcGIS REST API session.

get_token(client_secret)¶

Gets a token for an ArcGIS REST API session

Parameters

  • client_id (str) – ArcGIS client ID

  • client_secret (str) – ArcGIS client secret

Returns

ArcGIS REST API token

Return type

str

ussolar.esri.create_centroids(in_polygon, out_point)¶

Creates centroids for all features in polygon feature class.

Parameters

  • in_polygon (str, required) – Path to polygon feature class

  • out_point (str, required) – Path to output point feature class

Returns

None

Return type

None

ussolar.esri.delete_extra_fields(FC, keep_fields=[])¶

Deletes all non-required fields in a feature class

Parameters

  • FC (TYPE) – DESCRIPTION

  • keep_fields (TYPE) – DESCRIPTION

Returns

DESCRIPTION

Return type

TYPE

ussolar.esri.list_values(FC, field_names=[])¶

Returns a dictionary with all values for the requested fields in a feature class.

Parameters

  • FC (str, required) – Path to feature class

  • field_names (list, optional) – Fields requests, defaults to [] which returns ALL fields.

Returns

A dictionary where key:value = field_name:[values]

Return type

dict

ussolar.esri.spatial_join_mgmt(target_polygon, target_field, join_polygon, join_field)¶

Takes a Polygon layer and joins a single field from another polygon based on the centroid of the target_polygon

Parameters

  • target_polygon (str) – Path to the feature class you wish to join the field to.

  • target_field (str) – The name of the field that should be populated in the target_polygon during the join.

  • join_polygon (str) – Path to the feature class that is joined to the target_polygon

  • join_field (str) – The name of the field that will be joined to the target_polygon

Returns

None

Return type

None

ussolar.calc¶

The calc module contains functions and classes that perform various calcuations and generally extend the default python math library.

ussolar.calc.ft_to_m(ft)¶

Converts feet to meters

Parameters

ft (float) – Length in feet

Returns

Length in meters

Return type

float

>>> ft_to_m(1.5)
0.4572
ussolar.calc.get_slope(x1, y1, x2, y2, return_percentage=False)¶

Calculates slope. Returns value as rise/run or percent grade.

Parameters

  • x1 (float) – X value of first point.

  • y1 (float) – Y value of first point.

  • x2 (float) – X value of second point.

  • y2 (float) – Y value of second point.

  • return_percentage (bool, optional) – Returns value as percent grade instead of rise/run if set to True, defaults to False

Returns

Slope (rise/run if return_percentage = False, else percent grade)

Return type

float

>>> get_slope(1,1,3,3)
1.0

>>> get_slope(1,1,3,3,True)
100.0
ussolar.calc.round_trad(val, digits)¶

Rounds decimal places to the selected digit count.

Parameters

  • val (float) – Value to be rounded.

  • digits (int) – Number of decimal places to round to.

Returns

Rounded value

Return type

int

>>> round_trad(5.4352, 1)
5.4

>>> round_trad(5.4352, 2)
5.44
